author: pderop
msg: - When a Component.setDebug() method is used, we now log to the LogService instead of stdout.
- The Logger class can now configure its enabled log levels using the "org.apache.felix.dependencymanager.loglevel" bundle context property
The default for this property is 2, meaning all ERROR/WARNING are logged to the LogService, but not INFO or DEBUG messages.
set this property to 3 in order to enable ERR/WARN/INFO levels; or to 4 to enable all log levels.
- a Log interface is now exposed from the ComponentContext, in order to allow custom DM dependencies to be able to log debug messages
using the internal Component's Logger class. Doing so, allow to activate all Dependencies log levels by just calling Component.setDebug(String key) method.

author: uschindler
msg: LUCENE-5950: Disable Eclipse null analysis on Java 8 (requires @Null stuff Robert and I hate)
